slides.title: Domestication Origins
details: First domesticated ~15,000-40,000 years ago in Near East.

slides.title: Genetic Relationship to Wolves
details: Dogs share ~99.9% DNA with gray wolf.
Genus Canis includes wolves, coyotes, jackals.
Domestic dog is Canis lupus familiaris.

slides.title: Sensory Superpowers
details: Detect scents at parts per trillion.

slides.title: Roles in Human Society
details: Service dogs detect seizures, low blood sugar.
Search and rescue dogs locate missing persons.

slides.title: Health Impact on Humans
details: Parasites like ticks and fleas pose risks.

slides.title: Owner Responsibilities
details: Balanced nutrition and regular vet visits.

slides.title: Conclusion
details: Dogs evolved from wolves ~15,000 years ago.
They possess extraordinary olfactory and auditory senses.
Roles range from work to therapy to medical detection.
Responsible ownership improves health for both dog and owner.
Breed standards and genetics guide health and behavior.
